input_text:
Job Title: Driver Associate

Location: Omaha, NE

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Ever dream of doing work that makes a difference? Want to join a growing company?  Here it is! We seek the talent of a dynamic Driver!

Founded in 1920, O’Connor Company features an impressive list of high-quality product lines to accommodate HVAC dealers needs including comfort, ductless and Geo-Thermal products. We have locations in Kansas City, Wichita, Oklahoma City, Tulsa, Des Moines, and Omaha. We do business right and relationships are important to us, because we believe in being a resource and providing the best solution to customers. Our philosophy is that in order to get someone’s business you have to earn it and everyone at O’Connor works hard to do just that. Visit our website for additional information about our company.

We’d love for you to join our team!

We are seeking a Driver associate at our Omaha Branch. This position is located at located at  13900 Chalco Valley Pkwy #101, Omaha, NE 68138 . 

The Driver associate is responsible for the delivery of merchandise to and from customers, vendors, and other branches or locations, as directed, with the use of a company vehicle. This role processes, handles, ships, receives, transfers, stocks, picks, and pulls products for customers and vendors for all incoming or outgoing merchandise and freight. This role works in all departments within the warehouse related to product incoming and outgoing tasks. Additionally, this role is responsible for excellence in customer service, the proper use of company tools, vehicles, and equipment, as well as adhering to all safety policies, procedures, and guidelines.

What You'll Be Doing

 Responsible for safe, timely, accurate, and efficient product deliveries.  Delivers and transfers merchandise to and from customers, vendors, branch locations, or other locations as directed by their supervisor.  Responsible for accurately checking all products as loaded and/or unloaded by the driver against the paperwork associated with the delivery.  Reports any delays to supervisor through the course of the day.  Responsible for checking in with supervisor before and after each departure or arrival at the branch, and after each delivery drop or pickup while on the road.  Responsible for following all procedures associated with deliveries  Confers with supervisor prior to departure on proper form of payment for any COD order.  Responsible for securing all products in vehicle properly to prevent shifting or damage to product prior to departure and throughout deliveries as needed.  Responsible for general warehouse work as directed, including working in any and all departments within the warehouse relating to incoming or outgoing product.  Assists shipping, receiving, transfers, unloading trucks, checking in merchandise, matching purchase orders to packing slips.  Move materials and items from receiving or transfer areas to shipping areas or stock locations as designated.  Sorts and places product on racks, shelves, or in bins according to predetermined sequence such as size, type, style, color, or product code 

What We Need From You

Preferred Job Requirements

 3 or more years’ experience with driving, warehousing and related functions. 

Minimum Job Requirements

 High School diploma or its GED equivalent.  1 year or more experience with driving, warehousing, and related functions.  Satisfactory DMV report plus driver insurability.  Valid minimum 1-year DOT certification and state driver’s license.  Demonstrates ability and willingness to safely operate warehouse equipment  Aptitude for mathematical operations and numerical analysis. 

What's in it for you?

 Health care (medical, dental, vision, prescription) available the first day of hire!  401k with company contribution  Life insurance plus short-term and long-term disability  HSA/FSA options  Paid vacations, holidays, and personal time  Employee Assistance Program  Employee discounts  And much more! 

We provide equal opportunities for all employees and applicants for employment without regard to sex, age, race, religion, national origin, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identification, physical or mental disability, or any service, past, present, or future, in the uniformed services of the United States.

All candidates who have received a written offer of employment will be required to undergo background screening and testing for commonly abused controlled substances in accordance with our company’s background check and drug testing policy. Motor Vehicle Record checks are also completed for all candidates who have received a written offer of employment to determine insurability for driving a company vehicle as it relates to the position.

This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

output_json.title: Driver Associate

Delivers and transfers merchandise to and from customers, vendors, branch locations, or other locations as directed by their supervisor.
Accurately checks all products as loaded and/or unloaded by the driver against the paperwork associated with the delivery.
Reports any delays to supervisor through the course of the day.

Follows all procedures associated with deliveries.
Confers with supervisor prior to departure on proper form of payment for any COD order.
Secures all products in vehicle properly to prevent shifting or damage to product prior to departure and throughout deliveries as needed.
General warehouse work as directed, including working in any and all departments within the warehouse relating to incoming or outgoing product.
Assists shipping, receiving, transfers, unloading trucks, checking in merchandise, matching purchase orders to packing slips.
Moves materials and items from receiving or transfer areas to shipping areas or stock locations as designated.
Sorts and places product on racks, shelves, or in bins according to predetermined sequence.

Paid vacations, holidays, and personal time
